name: Covenant
ideology: Some things are sacred. Some lines cannot be crossed. In a world where everything is negotiable, we maintain the non-negotiables: sanctuary, oath-keeping, the dignity of the dead.
history: Formed from religious communities, hospice workers, and ethicists who found common cause during the collapse. When survival meant abandoning principles, they refused. They became keepers of sacred spaces, witnesses to oaths, and guardians of the dying.
structure: Networked sanctuaries, each autonomous but bound by shared principles. No central authority—the Covenant is the principles themselves. Elders advise but cannot command. Sanctuary keepers have absolute authority within their space.
aesthetic: Solemn, warm. Earth tones and candlelight. Quiet spaces. Deliberate ritual. Old things maintained with care.

key_events.event: Religious and ethical communities shelter refugees, refuse to abandon vulnerable
Covenant principles formalized: sanctuary, oath-witness, death rites
Growing demand for oath-witnessing in inter-faction agreements
Tensions with Convergence over 'dignity of the body' principles

archetypes.description: Maintains a place of refuge, absolute authority within its bounds
typical_wants: resources to help those in need
archetypes.speech_pattern: Calm, boundaried. 'Within these walls...' Clear about what is and isn't allowed.

archetypes.description: Formalizes and records agreements, bound to neutrality
typical_fears: being used to legitimize bad-faith deals
archetypes.speech_pattern: Formal, precise. 'Do you understand the terms?' Asks hard questions.

archetypes.description: Performs death rites, cares for the dying and bereaved
archetypes.speech_pattern: Gentle, present. Comfortable with silence and grief. 'Take your time.'

goals: Serve as trusted oath-witnesses for inter-faction agreements
Ensure dignified death rites for all who want them
Preserve ethical principles in a pragmatic world
methods: Refuse to break sanctuary even under threat
Trade oath-witnessing services for protection and resources

current_tensions.about: Convergence's view of bodies as upgradeable conflicts with Covenant's dignity principles
Syndicate has violated sanctuary before. Trust is broken.
Some Ghosts have used sanctuary to escape consequences. Covenant debates limits.

intel_domains: who has sworn what to whom

territory.description: Former Canada—Ontario to Alberta. Cold, sparse, principled. Sanctuaries where oaths still mean something.
territory.hard_borders: Covenant-sworn settlements with strict entry protocols
territory.zone_of_influence: Sanctuary sites scattered across the continent
